node.title: Doctors push for children over five to be vaccinated before WA's hard border comes down
node.alt: A man in a black suit speaks at a press conference
node.description: Doctors are pushing for Western Australia's hard border to stay in place until 90 per cent of the population over five is fully vaccinated, but Premier Mark McGowan is not keen.
node.content:
["The Australian Medical Association in WA wants the McGowan government to better protect children from COVID-19 and only reopen WA's\u00a0borders once 90 per cent of the population aged over five is\u00a0fully vaccinated \u2014 even if that means\u00a0further delays.", "The government plans to reopen WA\u00a0once\u00a090 per cent of the state's population aged over 12 is fully vaccinated, which is likely in late January or early February.", "But the national vaccine rollout has now been significantly expanded, after Australia's medical regulator provisionally approved Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine for children as young as five.", "That means those children could start to be vaccinated from early January, and before the 2022 school year starts.", "It would also be before WA reopens its borders.", "Premier Mark McGowan is likely to announce the exact date this coming week, after 80 per cent of WA's population aged over 12 has\u00a0had two doses of a COVID-19 vaccine.", "But AMA WA president Mark Duncan-Smith wants\u00a0the policy changed.", "\"I think now that we have approval for the five-year-olds and over I think they should be taken into account, because the ANU/UWA study suggested that to avoid significant mortality and morbidity or disease that we needed to get 90 per cent of the total population vaccinated,\" Dr Duncan-Smith said.", "", "
Around 220,000 children aged between 12 to 15 years old will become eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine.(Supplied: WA Health)
", "\"So now that we have the five-year-olds and over approved then I would like to see them included in the figures of 90 per cent.\"", "That would mean pushing back the opening by weeks or months.", "\"But people need to understand that approximately a quarter of cases of COVID in the eastern states now are in people under 19 years of age,\" Dr Duncan-Smith said.", "\"It is affecting the paediatric group and the NHS in the UK has recorded 7.4 per cent rate of long COVID.", "\"This is why we need to vaccinate the kids, and if it does mean pushing back the date by a couple of weeks then I think all West Australians, especially the ones with children, are going to be happy to do that to see the children protected better.\"", "
Policy will not be changing: Premier
", "Mr McGowan said the government would not be changing its strategy.", "But the move to rollout vaccines for children aged 5-11 in the new year was welcomed by the government.", "\"The point of our Safe Transition Plan is to reach the highest vaccination levels possible, so we have the softest landing and avoid the chaos that is now occurring in South Australia,\" Mr McGowan said.", "", "
Mark McGowan has been pushing for at least 90 per cent of WA's population over 12 to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.(ABC News: Eliza Laschon)
", "\"Today's announcement will complement the good work being done here in WA, where our first dose vaccination rate is [edging closer to] 90\u00a0per cent\u00a0for people aged 12 and over, and 80 per cent\u00a0for fully vaccinated.\""]
